meta_description: Fernando Filippetti — Electronic Engineer specializing in small satellite systems, education, and aerospace projects. Contributor to ATENEA for NASA's Artemis II mission.
meta_keywords: Fernando Filippetti, Electronic Engineer, Satellites, CubeSats, Artemis II, ATENEA, FIUBA, Aerospace Engineering
og_title: Fernando Filippetti — Aerospace Systems & CubeSat Engineering
og_description: Electronic Engineer specializing in small satellites and education. Collaborating on ATENEA / Artemis II.
title: Fernando Filippetti — Aerospace Systems & CubeSat Engineering
hero_desc: I develop systems for small satellites and help teams translate complex engineering into flight-ready components and learning paths.
hero_btn_artemis: Learn about the Artemis II work
card1_desc: Embedded systems, power, interfaces, integration constraints, and testing mindset for space hardware.
card2_desc: Building real capability through interdisciplinary teams, from concept to validation.
card3_desc: Making space technology understandable without diluting the engineering.
about_title: From the university lab to mission-grade standards
about_p1: I started in electronics with a strong interest in complex systems, communications, and building things that work under real constraints. Over time, that led me to the university ecosystem, student teams, and eventually aerospace projects that demand mission-grade discipline.
phase1_desc: Electronic engineering background. Initial focus on embedded systems, communications, and instrumentation. First serious builds in academic and hands-on projects.
phase2_desc: Teaching and mentoring. Working with interdisciplinary groups. Building repeatable engineering processes: documentation, testing, reviews.
phase3_desc: ASTAR initiative and CubeSat development approach. Collaboration with national institutions. Transition from prototypes to flight requirements thinking.
phase4_desc: Work connected to ATENEA as an international CubeSat payload for Artemis II. Engineering constraints for crewed mission context: safety, integration, procedures.
artemis_subtitle: The Argentine microsatellite selected for NASA's crewed lunar mission.
quest_artemis_desc: Artemis II is the first crewed test flight of NASA's Artemis program, planned as a crewed lunar flyby mission. Alongside the primary mission, NASA is flying a set of international CubeSats as secondary payloads.
quest_atenea_desc: ATENEA is a 12U Argentine CubeSat selected to fly as an international payload on Artemis II. Its objectives include radiation environment data, technology validation, and long-range communications demonstrations.
challenge1: Integration and safety standards tied to crewed mission context
challenge2: Engineering documentation, validation, and review cycles
faq1_q: Is ATENEA going to the Moon?
faq1_a: ATENEA deploys as a CubeSat payload before the lunar flyby phase and operates in a high Earth orbit / deep space relevant environment.
faq2_q: Why does a CubeSat matter in a crewed mission?
faq2_a: Crewed missions demand strict safety and integration discipline. Meeting those requirements is a strong test of engineering maturity.
proj1_desc: 12U international CubeSat payload for NASA's Artemis II mission. Work on electronics, integration support, and FIUBA/ASTAR collaboration within the broader ATENEA program.
proj2_desc: University initiative focused on developing and operating an experimental low Earth orbit satellite, emphasizing hands-on engineering, team learning, and a solid technical process.
proj3_title: How to build a satellite with free software
proj3_desc: Presentation at Nerdearla about the technical approach behind the ASTAR university satellite initiative, using open source tools for design, simulation, validation, and operations.
media1_title: NASA Signs Agreement with Argentina's Space Agency for Artemis II CubeSat
media2_title: An Argentine satellite will be part of Artemis 2
media4_title: From UBA to the Moon with NASA
media5_title: How to build a satellite with free software
media5_desc: Technical presentation at Nerdearla about developing satellites using open source tools.
media7_title: The Argentine microsatellite ATENEA in the Artemis II mission
media8_title: FIUBA, along with other national universities, in a NASA mission
contact_desc: If you want to discuss aerospace education, CubeSat development, or collaboration opportunities, drop me a line.
